speaker: Sigil Door
lines: A stone door blooms with frost-flowers, each a rune of protection.
Your breath lifts the smallest petals. They ring like crystal.
With a steady hand you trace the counter-mark taught in an old tavern rhyme.
The frost recedes in spirals, revealing chisel-strokes as neat as scripture.
A soft blue light travels the seam, hesitant, then certain.
Stone sighs like a sleeper turning and the way opens just enough for the stubborn.

give_item.name: Aegis Cloak
give_item.description: A cloak stitched with mountain sigils

choices.text: Slip through the opened seam toward the upper slopes.
